website_summaries.verdict: An amazing Intel processor that's ideal for playing video games and streaming HD videos.
pros: Seamlessly play video streams in ultra high-definition (UHD)
Empowers you with up to 12-way multitasking support
Features Intel Turbo Boost technology for fast, efficient performance
Boasts graphics dynamic frequency up to 1,200 MHz
cons: Code error sometimes occurs, reducing processor's speed
More expensive than similar Intel processors

website_summaries.verdict: The best computer processor for a noticeable all-around speed and performance boost.
pros: Maximum 4.7 gigahertz speed offers plenty of performance for gaming and computer graphics programs
cons: Processor requires extra cooling to prevent overheating

website_summaries.verdict: Expensive CPU, but it's designed to deliver maximum performance levels for high-end computing needs.
pros: Six-core processor that can run at up to 4.7GHz when in turbo mode
Will easily handle high-end applications like gaming, VR, and video processing without suffering dips in performance
Gives you the latest technologies in a CPU
cons: Occasional problems with shipping control quality
More expensive than many CPU chips

customer_reviews.title: I picked this over an 8700K for good luck
customer_reviews.text: I installed this on an Asus ROG Maximus X Code and it has bumped 5.3 running a mild bios gaming profile. It games very cool and quiet with a Corsair H110i set up for push/pull and 4 Noctua NF-A14 PPC2000 fans. I may keep it till the next anniversary....
customer_reviews.author: DP.

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW.
customer_reviews.text: The attached video shows the unboxing of this processor. The technical stuff is listed above, and I talked a little bit about it in the video. After getting my system built, and the testing I have done this far (not to mention the gaming I've been doing), all I can really say is "WOW". What an upgrade from the 4790K that I've been using. Which...importantly enough, is no slouch. But just everything about the system seems to be running so much better and faster with this processor. The i9 series is coming soon. I am sure they will be better/faster. But for now, this is an awesome value, and overall, just a great processor!
customer_reviews.author: Mav

customer_reviews.title: Prefered over the 9700K
customer_reviews.text: I did try the 9700K, came back to the 8700K hyper thread processor, my applications were sluggish with the 9700K even overclocked to 5.0 ghz. I guess if you’re into core heavy games only it would work for you, for the applications and gaming I do this is hands down the best all-around processor at this time and price point. You’ll need an appropriate AIO or larger air cooler to support the CPU. There is a reason this sells so well...all-around flat-out performance! Run this all day at 5.0 ghz and when needed absolute stability at 5.1 ghz with the ASUS Maximus XI code motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: MarvC

customer_reviews.title: Handles video transcoding quite well
customer_reviews.text: I waited four generations of Intel i7 CPUs to upgrade and it was so worth it! I didn't bother to get the unlocked version of this CPU because I don't overclock and I am still so impressed with this CPU. I use Handbrake to transcode video and this is so much faster than my i7 3770S. I will have this CPU running for many hours at 100% load and there are no issues using the stock CPU cooler. I can even browse the wed while this CPU is at full load. I couldn't do this with my 3770S.
customer_reviews.author: Owner

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Sent me a damaged processor. I couldn't use two memory sticks on my motherboard
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do this CPU is the best. I do some light CAD and some gaming and I’ve never had an issue. Performance never dips. Can run on the hotter side, but still not as bad as the 7700K.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: No support for Windows XP, 7, or 8 Operating Systems, Only Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact that Intel and Microsoft decided to support only Windows Operating System 10. Both companies no longer provide hardware and software support for any other Windows based Operating System. This is not stated on the Intel Processors i7-8700 and up with Intel and Microsoft not stating that fact anywhere in Advertisements or packaging. That information is only available on their websites in the requirements and/or specifications that the general Amazon purchaser needs to know up front since it requires both products users to completely upgrade all hardware and software if they want to upgrade either product, Windows 10 or as mentioned Intel CPU's in the 8th Generation and beyond.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Client

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have bought new memory, then I bought a new PSU replace another PSU, then I bought a new motherboard to replace another new motherboard. I was fighting with freezing. Now I have 100 % sure that all my problem was a CPU. When the temperature reaches 70-80 degree (C') CPU become a useless piece of silicone. I build many PC, this experience was so expensive for me. I have suspected PSU, memory, motherboard. Thank you Intel.
customer_reviews.author: vair

customer_reviews.title: WORTH IT!!
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to upgrade your CPU this i7-8700 will not let you down. I got it for my personal rig as it was my first build and I am not interested in overclocking so didnt need the "K" version. It it does everything and then some excellent for gaming if anything its overkill for gaming and for doing multiple tasks its a great choice. I used to hate not being able to have multiple chrome tabs open while streaming or doing other stuff on my i5. However I can say this was a great buy and if you go this route you wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lostagent23

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Beast
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an i5 2500k@5ghz and it’s a night and day difference. Everything left at stock settings, the 8700k hits 4.8ghz with complete stability and paired up with a 1080, handles everything thrown at it at 3440x1440. Fantastic chip and 8 years since the 2500k, Intel is still on top.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and solid buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Was getting into more VM work and needed more cores than my 6th gen i5 had to support them all. This did the trick. This is lightning fast on multi-core intensive processes. Never even breaks a sweat when gaming. Annihilates video processing. Does everything I need it to do and does it well. I don't both with overclocking components anymore since most processors can 10-20% overclock stock as long as they are cool enough. This one is pinned at a 20% overclock when under load since I have a lot of cooling for my case. Never been let down with my Intel CPU and this one is no exception. Always recommend this as a solid CPU buy.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Silicon is real
customer_reviews.text: Great chip. I bought this for my first ever PC build. I followed all instructions and it was fairly simple to install with limited knowledge. I bought my 8700k before the 9th gen i-series chips came out. The 6/12 c/t are great. I've had no buyer's remorse with this chip. I've managed to hit a solid 4.9Ghz OC with this chip work an air cooler (Dark Rock TF). ~35c idle, and 82c peak on load with a 3jr stress test. Gaming temperatures are around 62c in demanding games (BFV, R6 Siege, Overwatch). Pros: - No bottleneck - Good [average] consumer multi-tasker Cons: - Silicon lottery, not everyone's chip will be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Cortlan

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought a k-unlocked processor in the past (6600k) but chose to go with a locked one for no real reason this time, other than the imperceptible ~4% performance gain at the cost of my risking messing up my brand new processor made me decide to try the locked processor. I could care less about where I rank in synthetic benchmark software and there's virtual no "feelable" real life difference between the 8700 and 8700k, so that was my choice this time around. The improvement over the 4c/4t 6600k I was running at 4.1ghz is substantial, and I can stream in OBS while still pulling full FPS in all my usual games (PUBG, CSGO, etc.). Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: 8th Gen is moving forward, 6 Core makes this an upgrade from its predecessor 7700K.
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best CPU I've worked with so far. Fast fast fast, I LOVE IT. I own a 7700K as well and this thing is noticeably faster and with the higher core count its no wonder. Intel is an absolute pleasure to work with every time and easy to overclock. Another nice thing with this chip is Intel seems to be working on getting better temp control as this also seems to run cooler than the 7700K, both liquid cooled and and overclocked to 4.8Ghz.
customer_reviews.author: synthetic

customer_reviews.title: Its faster than my last CPU so what else matters?
customer_reviews.text: I paired my 8700K with an Asus Maximus X Hero and it's a wonderful combo. It's a fast CPU that is clear, the overclocking is again sadly not what it used to be with Intel since they stopped soldering their CPU heat spreaders. But I have been able to get a a stable overclock of 5.0Ghz at 1.24vcore using a Corsiar H100i v2. So looking like I could push it more if I delid it and upgrade the cooling. Not much else it say its fast and does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Nate B

customer_reviews.title: Fast and stable CPU
customer_reviews.text: Bought with a ASUS ROG B360-G motherboard about a year ago now. The CPU is fast and works great, both in games but also in photo and video editing. Value-wise, Ryzen is the better buy I feel, but I had issues trying to use 1st-gen Ryzen so I had decided to switch back to Intel, hence this i7-8700. I set the motherboard to keep the CPU at 4.3GHz (max all-core turbo) during heavy workloads, which is about the best "fake overclock" you can do on this CPU, and with the B360 chipset. Cooling the CPU is a CRYORIG M9i cooler I already owned.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU
customer_reviews.text: I build computers on the side for customers, and I've never ever had any bad luck with an Intel CPU and this is no different. They're always fast, and last a long time, of course I never overclock, but that's more so personal preference. Intel's by far ahead of the CPU game, especially with the thermal design, as other CPU's tend to run warmer. Heat & Dust is the number one killer of electronic components(excluding water, obviously). You can't go wrong by purchasing this CPU though.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Codere

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from my old i7 quad core 2.8 ghz cpu to this one and it has been a fantastic jump in speed. I had an old 7 year cpu that in its time was considered a fast cpu, but it was high time for me to update my system, so a new mother board, cpu and memory was needed. Windows 10 is quick, boot times are exceptional and video rendering is much quicker now.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence S.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe pricey, but it's actually great.
customer_reviews.text: I got so used to working on my PC with this processor I almost forgot how slow other PCs can be. I use my PC for development and I run a lot of heavy processing code on it, never felt lagging behind. I used this to build Android OS from source-code and it took about 40 minutes for 100% clean build. Any modifications thereafter usually take about 2-3 minutes. I also use my PC for gaming and quite frankly I don't feel like there is a game it can't handle well in combination with my GTX 1080.
customer_reviews.author: Ammar Salman

customer_reviews.title: Solid CPU for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this back in May 2018. Has been good to me for two years. It is common knowledge that there is an Intel tax & their chips run hot, however if you are able to find this for $250 or less you’re getting a great deal. Ryzen has made great strides, but if you purchased this from when it first released you may want to hold onto it for a bit longer. I have it undervolted so it generates less heat, and have water cooled it as well. I’m sure this will last me another 2-3 years before I make the jump to Ryzen.
customer_reviews.author: Jeigermeister

customer_reviews.title: High thermals due to poor TIM application
customer_reviews.text: I was getting super high thermals stock. Applications that use all 12 threads the temp would jump to 80c then slowly climb to 99c I had to delid the CPU and apply different thermal compound to the die/IHS You can see in the picture what was going on.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck right now for a mixed system.
customer_reviews.text: I do photo and video editing, gaming and VR. It plows through everything with ease. I highly suggest you delid - it dropped temps 20 C. I am running all 6 cores at 4.9 with a Corsair i115 cooler and it stays on low and quiet at all times.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: With a nice $100 Noctua air cooler you can destroy all your friends in benchmarks. Probably the best cpu next to the i9-9900k that you can buy. I can stream at higher quality than all my friends and get a little higher fps than most of them. Its fantastic. Best cpu I have had in my 20 years of gaming. COOLING IS KEY IF YOU DONT BUY A REALLY NICE AIR COOLER DONT EVEN BUY THIS. I was able to overclock mine to 4.7 without even touching voltage.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Lovegood

customer_reviews.title: Built a new pc and LOVE this cpu!
customer_reviews.text: And this thing is great! Good price, 6 core, and fast! I have played my htc vive on the highest graphics settings at 90fps, while streaming it live, and streaming it in Mixed reality. These things together provide a workload for a cpu and my old i7 4770k could do half of that. Almost got a second PC to use for streaming but this CPU is a BEAST!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Quite Nice
customer_reviews.text: Extremely nice 6 core. Clocked solid to 5 GHz. Some are hitting a higher over clock, but some are getting a lower one. As such I am quite satisfied. I'm running 4266 MHz ram at 4133 MHz-16-17-17-33, and if I was to down clock it to say 3800 MHz, I could probably get a higher stable CPU clock....
customer_reviews.author: Brian D. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Great option to upgrade to!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always had intel for my PC gaming builds and never had any problems. Top quality and reliable. Be sure you get the right motherboard that supports this 7th gen chipset. Great for gaming and windows programs and apps load so fast! You can watch the unboxing of it on my YT.
customer_reviews.author: Unboxophile

customer_reviews.title: A great processor does everything I want
customer_reviews.text: I agonized over which processor to buy. Ultimately, I chose the i7 8700 since I didn't really want to mess around with overclocking. While I always think I will, I never do so I just gave up and bought this processor. I have been very pleased with it. I don't have to worry about heat and it works like a dream on my new ASUS TUF motherboard. IT's a great combination and I an very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Pencil

customer_reviews.title: games that utilize more cores didn't see as good of a performance
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this for gaming and some light video work, it has netted me performance gains anywhere from 6-71% depending on the games. CPU intensive games on the single core saw the biggest improvement from my i7 5820k, games that utilize more cores didn't see as good of a performance. Overall very happy with it, and still haven't run any overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs cool enough here...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it can run a little on the warm side, but only when overclocked and fully loaded. I have a custom loop (no delidding!) and run the chip with all cores at 4.7 GHz, no AVX offset, and see temps as high as 65C (Prime95) and 75C (Prime AVX). This is still some 20-30 degrees below the specified maximum. Gaming is typically somewhere in the 40's C, aka "just fine". I saw 50-55C loaded with the processor at stock settings. If you overclock the hell out of the thing, you will need to delid and ramp up your cooling strategy.
customer_reviews.author: D_Leone

customer_reviews.title: Best performance and price
customer_reviews.text: Came fast and packaged well. The CPU itself is the best chip for gaming unless you want to spend $400+ but anything past a 9700k is overkill and unless your doing some application stuff or money is no object then stick with this. I switched from an fx 9370 and that was 4.5ghz 8core and this runs alot better and uses half the power. I added water cooling but prob not needed. I got this sitting at 4.7ghz at 15c
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent processor easy overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Excellent processor for the price. 6 cores for under $400 is not bad at all. My Extreme 3960X was $1K and had the same core and it had stability issues when it was OC over 4.25ghz. With this CPU it overclocked right out of the box @ 4.7ghz using water cooling; stays @30C @ underload, around 41-42C. while gaming and running stress tests. I have run through no issues with this cpu. Its stable and runs at cool for a 6 core non extreme chip.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Manhattan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go with my Asus Rog Strix Z370-E mobo. This thing is a beast. Preferred it over the skylake i7' Build: i7 8700k Asus Rog Strix z370-e Mobo Team T-Force Night Hawk RGB 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4 3200 600W EVGA B1, 80+ BRONZE DEEPCOOL GENOME II WH-BL Case with integrated 360mm liquid cooling system Wd black 256gb m2 ssd 5tb HDD Storage Gigabyte AORUS GeForce GTX 1060 6G REV 2.0 GPU
customer_reviews.author: Nigel G

customer_reviews.title: This thing is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace an I7 7700k so I could use that to build another PC in my office room. This thing has been OC to 5100 MHz and has been running steady for a month now with noticeable difference in fps especially in War hammer 2 which is cpu intensive. I would recommend this to anyone that has the $$$ to drop on a great cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Destin Prime

customer_reviews.title: Fast and hot when overclocked
customer_reviews.text: I had to upgrade from air cooling to watercooling, as well as delid and apply liquid metal between the die and the heatspreader. But it now holds a stable 5GHz. Draws about 175watts doing it, toss in my video card and power supply losses, my machine draws 430watts from the wall. But boy howdy is it fast. Excellent chip! I’m using an Asrock Z370 Taichi board and a Corsair H150i watercooler. Full load temps are around 61°C, with water temps around 31°C in a 21°C room.
customer_reviews.author: UnaClocker

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: He built his own computer and after months of research he chose this processor. After much back and forth about speeds etc, he is now gaming with it nearly everyday and he loves the quality of the product. He was so amazed with the speed he couldn’t stop smiling for at least a week after trying it the first time. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Original Dakota

customer_reviews.title: This CPU is very excellent performing tasks is flawless no lags or delays
customer_reviews.text: I have brought and installed this product already into my motherboard. This CPU is very excellent performing tasks is flawless no lags or delays. Summary of the performance: -High clock sped base runs at 4.5 GHz constant on high performance mode. -Able to run 3 dfifferent files on around 4GB each being compressed into a ZIP file at the same time. Along with running mutiple tabs on browsers. -Extremely fast CPU runs at 50 degrees no overheating. -Handles video editing very well for basic cutting video clips in a couple of seconds. Thsi is an overall amazing CPU chip and would recommend it to anyone is after a very fast CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Muazzam

customer_reviews.title: Great processor!
customer_reviews.text: What can be said about this processor beside that it's an absolute beast? I upgraded from my 6 year old i7-3930k, and the difference is quite noticeable. Websites that rendered slow before now render instantly, and this is using the same GPU as before - 980ti. Programs open instantly. Everything is really snappy. The single core speed is very noticeably fast. Great processor!
customer_reviews.author: Joe K

customer_reviews.title: Solid performance at a decent price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute beast for the price, the OC potential is heavily reliant on having good supporting components (cooler, airflow+case, psu). Even at stock it's a hell of a performer, good to see Intel over builds these. Silicone lottery is still very much present, purchased two with one easily oc-ing at 5.0 @ 1.38mv while the other needs 1.39 to consistently hit 4.8. Make sure to pray to the silicone gods.
customer_reviews.author: Riktar

customer_reviews.title: ... 5ghz with an Asus x370-A mobo and Corsair h100i-v2 easily with temps running cool
customer_reviews.text: Hit 5ghz with an Asus x370-A mobo and Corsair h100i-v2 easily with temps running cool. I backed it off to 4.8 because I want it to last. It matches well with my Evga 1080 ftw2.
customer_reviews.author: adavidwiththekropps

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: As with most Intel products, it just works. Being cooled by a 360mm radiator in push-pull config it idles at 28C and only gets up to 55C under full load. Plenty of overclocking head room, people push these to 5GHz on all cores stable every day. I just don't have any reason to do so, personally. Runs everything I can throw at it without issue.
customer_reviews.author: V91-Bleach

customer_reviews.title: Very fast and stable.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No issues running at the stock clock. Fast and reliable. I guess I won the CPU lottery. Haven't played with any over clocking yet. System runs well enough at the stock settings. Just decided to go with the unlocked model for future options.
customer_reviews.author: Dmorg258

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CPU!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great CPU for any PC build! I was trying to wait for Intel's 10nm chips, but I think I may get too old before that happens. This was the next best thing! It is an affordable, romping fast CPU that will handle just about anything you can throw at it. Very easy to install, but you need some type of cooler. I use a liquid cooler that keeps it at about 30 C.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Just Wow
customer_reviews.text: This CPU came out of the box clocked at 5.0 as advertised. With liquid cooling my ASUS Maximus X Formula clocked this CPU to 5.4 on the first try. It runs like that all day, everyday with no issues. This CPU is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: The i7 8700 is awesome. Everyone wants the k series but overclocking is over rated. You will just burn your CPU out eventually and have to buy a new one. These have a turbo boost feature that will boost you Ghz when needs. Its base clock speed is plenty fast for any normal gaming.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Rawk n roll!
customer_reviews.text: 5.1 GHz @ 1.36Vcore, will do 5.2 stable, but I keep it at 5.1 for the lower voltage and longevity. Definitely delid these! I got a 19C drop (P95 small AVX) w/Conductonaut and Rockit Cool copper IHS. Stays nice and cool after the delid using Corsair H100i V2 cooler 70's C in P95 small AVX.
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Kayla Bryant

customer_reviews.title: I can easily go to 5
customer_reviews.text: Binned 8700K, simple as that. No need to play the silicon lottery. Upgraded from a 7700K, that ran at 5.0Ghz @ 1.35V. The 8086K does 5.0Hhz @ 1.20V, 61°C on all 6 cores without delid. I can easily go to 5.3+ Ghz (reduced efficiency, greater than 1.3V+). I'm very happy with it, gains all around in gaming, day to day and pretty much everything. If you already have an 8700K then I wouldn't recommend it, but otherwise this is a great "8700K".
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Just make sure you get an good aftermarket cooler
customer_reviews.text: Strong performance in games and productivity applications. A lot of Overclocking headroom. Just make sure you get an good aftermarket cooler. I am running it on a air cooler. (Enermax ETS-T40) it stays around 40 Celsius Non OC. A friend of mine is using liquid cooling and hers stays around 30 Celsius Non OC, That is a lot of room to OC. The die temp is 100 Celsius. Just remember to get a Z370-series board or it will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming CPU
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is a complete beast for gaming and will be for the next few years considering nearly every one can be easily over locked to 5GHz requiring on average 1.35v for that. Unfortunately my CPU needed 1.395v to stay stable but with my watercooling that was no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Fast, runs cool with air
customer_reviews.text: Very fast, and runs cool with my air cooler (Noctua CPU Cooler [NH-U12S]). This is for a business PC I knew I'd never OC and I like the idea of less power, which usually equals less heat, so I got the non-K 8700. So far, very good. Does not bog down regardless of the multi-tasking of CPU hungry programs.
customer_reviews.author: Cain

customer_reviews.title: As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it claims to do out of the box. If you're patient and watch the big tech dealers, you can get this proc on a downswing price-wise - it fluctuates quite a bit if you keep eyes on it.. But dont linger too much as it sells out quickly! The proc is the centerpiece of my new 2018 build in a Corsair Air 540 Arctic White dual chamber case. Cooling is by a Corsair H105 AIO solution. Proc sits nicely in the EVGA Z370 Classified K mobo.
customer_reviews.author: Danbo

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I decided to go higher end on my recent PC build, and wow.... I've never had a PC this powerful before. This thing boots in no time, runs games at max settings, smooth as silk. I don't know what else to say, I don't have anything that I can throw at it that will make it stutter.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: It's very fast
customer_reviews.text: My computer runs a lot better now that I switched to Intel and dumped the AMD completely. This is a very good processor, I've played a lot of games on it so far and it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Finally a cost concious I7 processor
customer_reviews.text: Solid built and well priced high end processor. Guess that says it best. Past I7's would break the bank but at around 300.00 Intel is finally bowing to competition as this is about 75.00 lower than last years model when it came out. There are new features in this new 8th Gen processor. More cores, more threads and turbo mode which throttles up when you need the power and is less power hungry in between those times.
customer_reviews.author: Casch

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't come with a cooler
customer_reviews.text: this cpu being as it is amazing sadly does not come with a stander cpu cooler and fan like older ones did understanding a stock cooler is not the best but i couldn't use it till i got one in the mail 2 days later so the entire build was useless and not known if it was going to work right away was a bit stressful but it did thankfully other than that with the right cooler the cpu can run over clocked at low temps and even on its bas 3.7Hz clock runs very good and had no issue with it
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: A heavyweight CPU for OC and Gaming
customer_reviews.text: If you already own the 8700k your waste your money on upgrade to the 9th generation This 8700k run very fast and with a good cooling water solution you can OC this beat to 5.1 Ghz at 1.35v with good stable temperature as I did , I get in idle 34 degrees celsius and full load all cores around 77-79 degrees celsius. This CPU for gaming and programs than use no more than 2 to 4 cores is the king of mainstream . The only downside is the price , it will be a very heavy weight to compete with Ryzen 2700x on the price range
customer_reviews.author: Mauricio B

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for gaming.
customer_reviews.text: This might have been overkill but the price was right. Installation was like any other LGA 1151. Amazon seems to think I should comment on it's comfort so I guess I'll say that it hasn't made me uncomfortable like the AMD processor I had burn itself down so it has that going for it. Overall it was a great CPU for the price and I don't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Morkeleb

customer_reviews.title: Car is running perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my car and it’s been working wonderfully. The car has been getting a good gas mileage since installing this. Very happy with my purchase. Recommended for all car owners out there.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Great for Photo editing
customer_reviews.text: Not a gamer. Custom build for Photoshop and Lightroom primarily. If it can handle that others a piece of cake. Photoshop and Lightroom do access all the available threads so workflow much faster than past ancient i7 in old desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Tbabij

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically powerful processor
customer_reviews.text: I'm primarily a gamer and a power user. This processor will run any game at excellent capacity that you throw at it. This is one of the best processors on the market for it's price point and I recommend it thoroughly if you're looking to build a computer that will have no trouble running any video game superbly now and for a lot of time to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Would love to give it 5 stars but cooling fan is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I would give this 5 stars but the cooling fan and heat exchanger is not good enough. I have since bought an after market cooler to cool this and have reduced max temps by about 22 deg C. The chipe itself is great and fast but the stock cooler is terrible. 4 stars just for that. The cooler is a waste.
customer_reviews.author: K. Swain

customer_reviews.title: Worth the upgrade from X99
customer_reviews.text: Debated for awhile on of I should upgrade from my 5930K since it is already a 6 core. I was able to overclock to 5GHz at 1.31v with ease. Did have to delid to keep temps in check. Will upload a graph comparing performance of this chip vs my old 5930K at 4.6GHz
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: I built a new system around this processor and a 1050ti vid card. I use the computer for many things, but the most visually intense thing I do is play Everquest, I went from loading a single account in 3-4 minutes with my old system to loading 4 accounts from desktop to fully operational in less then 2 minutes. Extremely happy with the performance.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Great performance but it wont help FPS at all if you game in 2k and 4k
customer_reviews.text: Runs a little hotter than a 7700k but that because it has more cores I guess. Idle and game temps are the exact same with a push/ pull cooler as the 7700k. No dellid performed so I can testify to those temps as I do not know.
customer_reviews.author: Redmon

customer_reviews.title: Better Than i7 7700k @5ghz
customer_reviews.text: Way better than i7 7700k. Hotter than most at stock speeds so AIR cooler isn't recommended. Requires 8th generation LGA1151 motherboard. Overclocked to 5ghz easily and stays under 50c at FULL LOAD. Multitasking is great for 6 cores/12 threads.
customer_reviews.author: Clark V

customer_reviews.title: ✔ Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The coffee lake i7-8700k CPU with the Z370 Aorist Gaming 7 motherboard, 280mm enclosed loop liquid cooler, two enclosed loop liquid cooled GTX 1080ti. I'm getting consistently 22c temps and mid 30's when gaming, never over 40. I haven't over clocked or delid the CPU runs every game at highest settinga without any problem. Well worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Scrat

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor for non Overclockers.
customer_reviews.text: The processor is really great fast and efficient even though its non K and the base clock speed is 3.2 MHz you can still get the clock speeds up to 4.4 MHz on all cores with the turbo boost which is always on whenever you are gaming or putting loads on CPU. For me personally its not worth it paying 50-80$ for the K version just to get an extra 600 MHz going up to 5 MHz with the OC which requires you to spend more on CPU cooling which adds to the price of the K version.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulla

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with heatsink
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, but it would've been nice to know that a heatsink was not included like they used to be. I had to wait an extra 2 days to power up the machine because of that.
customer_reviews.author: IridescentShadow

customer_reviews.title: Decreased performance over time
customer_reviews.text: Great processor but very disappointing how performance gets worse every couple months due to security hole patches.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Stable at 5.3 GHz!!! (Prime 95 26.6, Realbench, and 3DMark verified)
customer_reviews.text: I have mine stable at 5.3 GHz! Liquid cooled with a copper IHS and liquid metal between die and IHS. Temps are fine but volts are higher than most would be comfortable with. :) I have settled on 101.0 BLCK and 52 multiplier with 1.435 with -0.100 offset VCore and -2 AVX for ever day use at 5.252 GHz. This slight drop in frequency was to avoid my computer acting like a space heater. :) :) :) Keeping the CPU cool was not the issue, but the dual radiators I was running can put out some heat in the process!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hoeth

customer_reviews.title: Used Like New and Works
customer_reviews.text: Very good cpu, If you don't have the right cooling for it it will be too hot for your pc so I suggest either delidding it for crazy good temps with conductonaut but ruined warranty, a really good air cooler, or (the best one of them all for those who don't want to maintain their loop a lot) Aio. There's also custom looping but that's too much for a gamer like me or anyone else like me.
customer_reviews.author: MikeK

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Overall I love my new processor. It runs great, obviously won't be perfect if your system doesn't match it's capabilities but I did a brand new build myself and it's perfect. Luckily I know how to install a CPU because I paid an extra $30 to have it installed on my motherboard and it didn't come preinstalled. Plan to ask for the $30 back but otherwise great product and I'd recommend. Be sure to research this first before you do though people (friendly tip from an IT guy)
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for gaming as well as running multiple VMs.
customer_reviews.text: I am running six virtual servers using just this one processor. It is performing flawlessly. Also the price has gone up about $100 since I got it which makes my system worth that much more if I wanted to change it for some crazy reason.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Mouse

customer_reviews.title: First CPU purchase, works great with Linux
customer_reviews.text: Use this primarily for programming, and internet things. Not much gaming has been done, but I'd assume it would work fine. I have not overclocked it that much. The temperatures are stable, it's easy to install, supported by most motherboards, so I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Kned

customer_reviews.title: meh is a good description for the price.
customer_reviews.text: More vulnerabilities than you can shake a stick at and a QA decision that seems to OK these chips at random. Consider a new Ryzen, you will get all that this chip has to offer for less $$ and a much higher degree of consistency in overclock ability and performance per watt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, owned for over a year with no problems
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this cpu sometime in the fall of 2018 and it's not failed me. It runs cool, is stable and does all I need for it to do and more. I can run most software and games without any hitch. I can see some life on this cpu for some years to come, despite more advanced cpus being available right now. I've been happy with it and has proved its worth many times over. However, one may be better off getting the newer core i7s or core i9s over this one if building a new rig. Having said that, you can't go wrong with this cpu.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: It's a very nice
customer_reviews.text: When I say this thing is hot af, I'm not referring to the temps. This thing actually runs pretty cool with a decent cooler mounted on top of it. Just make sure you don't fudge around with the overclocking, otherwise you'll void the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Probably best bang for the buck for gaming PC as of Dec. 2018
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning for a 9900K as I wanted the top end and Amazon got them in stock for regular price shortly after I ordered the 8700K. My friends are rocking the 8700K in their rigs and have nothing but praise for it.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin T Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance
customer_reviews.text: I built my new system with the i7-8700K as the heart. My old PC was running on Win 7 32-bit and a CPU that was 10 years old. It was time for an upgrade. I have it overclocked at 4.9 GHz and the temp stays under 35C. The MB is a GIGABYTE Z370 AORUS Gaming 5 with 16 GB RAM and a Cooler Master Hyper RR-212E-20PK-R2 LED CPU cooler. OS is Win 10 Home 64-bit.
customer_reviews.author: RoadiJeff

customer_reviews.title: Best in Tier for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I've been told this is the best you can buy for the money in 2018-2019.. seems to work fine never have a problem, you will need to get one of those coolers this doesn't come with one, I got a really cheap water loop system that was like $23 to go with it, and it honestly worked really good.
customer_reviews.author: Dash

customer_reviews.title: Incredible!
customer_reviews.text: Coming from 4790K I was skeptical, this is a huge leap in the right direction for Intel and the consumer, have never played with frames so smooth and hardly breaks 30c playing games, around 25c at idle using NH-D15 for cooling, extremely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work for what I need it for.
customer_reviews.text: I built my computer for office work and possible future gaming/Tv. I have not pushed this core to its limits but for multiple programs open, it has worked very well. Locking it in was easy and came with a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty J

customer_reviews.title: Good processor but not any better than the Ryzen processors
customer_reviews.text: Good processor but not any better than the Ryzen processors. I built my sone a Ryzen system and his is just as fast as mine if not faster. But with that it is still plenty fast enough for anything that you want to throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Martin

customer_reviews.title: Is stable so far - great for non OC gaming
customer_reviews.text: Bought this instead of its K version because I game, but do not OC. My build was completed in July of 2019 and the CPU and entire computer has been doing awesome so far. Very stable and works well in my ASRock TaiChi board.
customer_reviews.author: L. Michele Scott

customer_reviews.title: Super performance
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Super fast(beats ryzen 1800x) on benchmarks for games or any program that works good with high-speed CPU clock per core. Cons: This is an OVEN!!! Spent $80 on a CPU FAN cooler and it runs at 52'c yes it's pretty low for it but heats up my case if fans are not on high.
customer_reviews.author: Marrero Family

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a CPU
customer_reviews.text: Sent this off to the Silicon Lottery the moment I got it. They delidded, applied liquid metal thermals, and benchmarked it for me. They sent it back with the OC settings to apply in my BIOS. Got it back and I run it at 5.1Ghz with a Corsair H150i cooler. Not going to bother linking benchmarks or temps, there's a million of them out there.
customer_reviews.author: Gridsquare

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with the build
customer_reviews.text: I used this to build a mini itx gaming rig. I am happy with the build. I didn't realize it was an 8700, not an 8700k until after I got it. Totally my fault. I wish I had paid more attention to this so I could attempt to over clock it. But that being said, it runs all the games I currently have 10 times better than the old xeon I had in my last rig. It wasn't meant for gaming though.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: The box came destroyed
customer_reviews.text: I received my CPU hand delivered by some dude driving a civilian vehicle.. Like what am I supposed to do with that? I honestly was just excited to build my PC and when everything came together it was fine.. I had a few BSODs here and there, but apparently it was normal for Custom PCs to receive BSODs.. Do you know how many BSODs I have accumulated over the year? I have received over 30+ BSODs and I'm pretty sure at that point it was abnormal. A ton of people are pointing towards faulty hardware, so now I have to replace the hardware..
customer_reviews.author: Umbra

customer_reviews.title: Insane
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'll ever do anything that can max out this processor. I'll have 20+ tabs open while browsing, playing a game while watching YouTube, and automated trading application testing, still only takes maybe 25% of CPU usage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Petty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Non-Overclock builds
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what I need it to. As far as I can tell, this isn’t overclock-approved. Regardless, I do not overclock and therefore this is the ideal CPU without being excessive. 1151 pin, with notches to show how it is supposed to be oriented. I recommend the EVOHYPER 120mm radiator cooling as the cooling module. The stock that comes with this does the job, but it’s not ideal for gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I miss seeing a boot screen sometimes. This gets my computer up and running faster than my monitor can turn on. On top of that, even with lack of a GPU, I can still run most relevant games without any lag on full graphic settings. Surprisingly powerful processor.
customer_reviews.author: invalidsource

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great processor! comes with thermal paste and cooler in case anyone was wondering
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Very fast processor and pretty good price. I used this on an ASRock mini-itx Z370 motherboard with Corsair 2666 memory in a Corsair Carbide 240 Air case and love it. Runs nice and cool.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Osborne

customer_reviews.title: SUPER FAST!! great upgrade from the i5
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from the i5 6600k. and it is a huge improvement from the i5. super fast...had to get a new motherboard of course and decided on ASUS ROG Maximus X Hero(with wifi). works great with that motherboard. overclocked it to 4.8 GHz on all cores with stock settings. running great with stable and low temps with Noctua NH-D15 air cooler. this is a great processor...if you have i3 or i5 this is an absolute must have upgrade in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Xrayz

customer_reviews.title: Intel 250 MB won't work.  If you have to buy a mobo, go AMD
customer_reviews.text: Meh. I thought I could do an easy Intel upgrade on my B250M Pro-vd mb. Sadly, no. The MB claims i7, but caveats later, I'm buyinga mobo. It would have been cheaper and more performant to go AMD.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: It hauls ass
customer_reviews.text: It hauls ass. It is a powerhouse. Not much else to say. It is a good CPU and the best part it is a INTEL not some second rate CPU. Intel is the only way to go. Ive been building PC's since mid 1980's. For compatibility with other hardware, speed, durability, bang for the buck...you cant beat intel hands down. You get what you pay for remember that. Want to build a cheap PC? Then expect to get cheap results. Just that simple period!
customer_reviews.author: Nunya Bussiness

customer_reviews.title: Great, fast CPU!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this CPU installed for over a year now and it's still running like it was the first day. It stays at a nice temperature and my computer is blazing fast. Don't hesitate to put this in your PC build!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew smith

customer_reviews.title: It’s the beast
customer_reviews.text: -easily overclockable up to 5ghz -Totally worth upgrading from 6th gens 10/10 money well spend
customer_reviews.author: Abtin

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to leace it at max at 4.8gh if your planning to overclock
customer_reviews.text: This processor is a great one for gaming and all I gave it a 4 because it stoped working 2 months after getting it so has to get in contact with intel and they refunded me back, which it was quick and ended up with the new intel core i9 9900k
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Still relevant, g** d****t
customer_reviews.text: Lots of new Ryzen chips out there that are amazing and offer great bang for the buck. But if you are just upgrading an 1151 socket then this gets you pretty close to the best performance from the newer i7's for cheaper. Still going strong in 2019.
customer_reviews.author: J. Leonis

customer_reviews.title: Good upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPU as an upgrade for my 5960x build. Nice core speed. OC's above 5 gigs easily. Con's : Lack of PCI-E lanes. If this had at least 40 lanes of PCI-e it would be the absolute best.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C. Prince

product_meta.title: Intel Core i7-8700K Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.7GHz Turbo Unlocked LGA1151 300 Series 95W
product_meta.description: Size:Processor| Style:Core i7-8700KOutstanding gaming experiences extend beyond personal gameplay to your entire gaming community. Share those experiences by live-streaming or recording, editing, and posting your epic highlights.
feature_bullets: Compatible only with Motherboards based on Intel 300 Series Chipsets
3.70 GHz up to 4.70 GHz Max Turbo Frequency / 12 MB Cache

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars3,659 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
